title: Doesn't Anyone in the U.S. Government Like the U.S.?
summary: Another disturbing message seeps out of the Federal Reserve.. "Woke" seems like too nice a term for people who casually toss around vicious smears against the United States. Particularly galling is when rhetorical attacks on U.S. liberty come from tax-consuming officials at the most dubious arms of the federal government. Did the Federal Reserve recently publish one such attack?

title: Hertz Names Former Ford CEO as Interim Chief
summary: Mark Fields to take top job as car-rental company resets after emerging from bankruptcy. Hertz Global Holdings Inc. tapped former Ford Motor Co. CEO Mark Fields as its interim chief executive and moved Chief Executive Paul Stone to the role of president and chief operating officer.

title: The Debt Ceiling Deception
summary: Biden gives away the real reason Democrats won't use the budget bill.. Democrats keep telling Americans they have the votes and a mandate to pass the biggest tax increase since 1968 and the biggest domestic spending bill ever. Yet they also claim they're helpless to raise the federal debt ceiling without Republican votes.

title: Facebook Needs to Empower Parents, Not Censor Political Speech
summary: The company wants to appease politicians but it should worry more about users.. Facebook has become the latest company that everyone loves to hate, and internal documents stolen by an employee have become an opening to blame the social-media giant for America's ills. The company has made mistakes, but it's worth sorting the genuine issues from the opportunism of politicians looking to censor opponents.

title: The FBI's Other Secret Warrant Abuses
summary: More evidence that the bureau abuses the FISA court process.. Congress has failed to reform federal surveillance laws, despite the FBI's 2016 abuse of a secret court to spy on the Trump presidential campaign. The latest report from Justice Department Inspector General Michael Horowitz on the FBI's other surveillance abuses is more evidence of the need to overhaul the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act.

title: Boris Johnson's Autumn of Discontent
summary: Britain's Tories are losing their reputation for competence.. It's hard to believe it's less than two years since U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson won a historic electoral mandate on a platform of getting Brexit done and unleashing Britain's economic dynamism. It's also hard to recall the last time anything went right for him, leaving his Conservatives in a precarious spot as they hold their annual convention this week.

title: What College Rankings Don't Tell You
summary: Students fill in important details that can't fit in the annual lists.. Editor's note: This Future View discusses the utility of college rankings. Next week we'll ask, "How is your school responding to the pandemic? Any improvements from last semester or the same old mistakes?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before Oct. 12. The best responses will be published that night.

title: George Floyd Should Get Posthumous Pardon, Texas Parole Board Says
summary: Recommendation follows allegations police officer likely lied during Floyd's arrest in 2004 over $10 drug sale. The Texas parole board has unanimously voted to recommend George Floyd receive a posthumous pardon for a low-level drug charge in 2004.

title: The Facebook Whistleblower, Frances Haugen: Does the Law Protect Her?
summary: Frances Haugen testified before Congress after revealing herself as the Facebook Whistleblower. The former Facebook Inc . employee who gathered documents that formed the foundation of The Wall Street Journal's Facebook Files series faces an uncertain legal landscape as she speaks publicly about the social-media company's practices, said attorneys who specialize in federal whistleblower laws.

title: Science Closes In on Covid's Origins
summary: Four studies-including two from WHO-provide powerful evidence favoring the lab-leak theory.. Where did Covid-19 come from? The answer can be found in the SARS-CoV-2 virus itself. To get to the truth, we need only unleash the power of science.

title: Deregulation and U.S. Energy Independence
summary: Fracking and an end to the oil-export ban turned America into a global powerhouse.. The U.S. in 2019 became a net exporter of energy and achieved energy independence. Once at the mercy of hostile foreign governments that used energy supply as a cudgel, the U.S. is now the third-largest energy exporter in the world-a stunning reversal that has driven down prices for American consumers and created more than 10 million jobs in domestic energy.

title: Dangers Of a Digital Dollar
summary: If widely used, it would give the central bank unprecedented power over the financial system.. The Federal Reserve plans to consider the idea of launching a U.S. digital currency. Central bank digital currencies are a hot topic among monetary-policy makers world-wide. More than 80 countries, representing 90% of the world's gross domestic product, are looking into the technology. But these currencies come with serious risks. Without additional privacy measures, central bankers shouldn't establish them.

title: Offshore Finance for Beginners
summary: What the tax-dodging exposés leave out is a story of geopolitics as well as greed.. First there were the Panama papers, then the Paradise papers, now the Pandora papers. Unleashed on Sunday by multiple news outlets was the latest avalanche of private financial records mysteriously "obtained" by the nonprofit International Consortium of Investigative Journalists and its Australia-based leader, Gerard Ryle.

title: Crime Is Up and Democrats Are Scrambling
summary: It's getting harder to convince people that the police are a bigger problem than the criminals.. Last week's Federal Bureau of Investigation report on the nationwide rise in homicides might be the least surprising news of the year. Nor is it any shock that the political left is trying to duck blame for the trend.

title: 'The Vanishing' Review: The Cross and the Crescent
summary: An increase in attention to the plight of Christians in the Middle East must be matched by an increase in understanding.. Janine di Giovanni's "The Vanishing: Faith, Loss, and the Twilight of Christianity in the Land of the Prophets" opens and closes with beautiful evocations of the power of faith in trying times. Speaking of how her own faith guided her through the initial uncertainty of the Covid-19 pandemic, she ties this experience to the strong testaments of faith she witnessed-and experienced-while reporting on the Middle East's diminishing Christian communities. Ms. di Giovanni, an award-winning author, journalist and former Guggenheim Fellow, found new meaning in the traditions of her Catholic upbringing. "Faith meant two things to me: ritual and a sense of belonging," she writes. "Regardless of where I was in the world, I felt a sense of being part of a larger community, no matter how difficult, dark, or dangerous the situation was."

title: Federal Court Blocks California Law Banning Private Prisons
summary: Two judges on appeals panel say law stops Homeland Security Secretary from executing federal immigration law. A federal appeals court ruled a California law that bans private prisons can't stand because it impedes on federal immigration policy.

title: Facebook Blames Engineering Error of 'Our Own Making' for Outage
summary: The social-media giant says restoring services was slowed by measures taken to safeguard systems. A simple technical mistake caused a global outage Monday that left more than 2.9 billion internet users unable to access Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and other tools.

title: Carl Icahn Holds Significant Stake in Southwest Gas, Opposes Planned Deal
summary: In a letter to Southwest's board, the activist investor said a purchase of Questar Pipeline for around $2 billion would diminish shareholder value. Carl Icahn has a significant stake in Southwest Gas Holdings Inc. and is pushing the Nevada utility to abandon a planned acquisition and focus on improving its share price instead, he said in a letter to the company this week.

title: Microsoft Released Windows 11. But Should You Upgrade?
summary: The newest Windows operating system got a nice makeover, but we're still waiting for Android-app compatibility and other game-changing features. Plus, your PC might not even be eligible for the update.. There are two types of Microsoft Windows upgraders:

title: Facebook Whistleblower's Testimony Builds Momentum for Tougher Tech Laws
summary: Former employee Frances Haugen, who was source of internal documents, testified before Senate consumer protection panel. WASHINGTON- Facebook Inc. whistleblower Frances Haugen testified to Congress Tuesday on internal documents showing harms from the company's products-from teenagers' mental-health problems to poisoned political debate-adding fuel to efforts to pass tougher regulations on Big Tech.

title: Stocks End Higher After Selloff; Oil Rally Builds
summary: Technology stocks climb following Monday's sharp losses. U.S. stocks rose on Tuesday following Monday's tech-driven selloff, while supply-and-demand friction pushed energy prices to multiyear highs.

title: Biden Visits Michigan to Promote Agenda Tied Up in Congress
summary: President says legislative packages are needed to keep the U.S. competitive, but Democrats haven't reached a deal on them yet. WASHINGTON-President Biden traveled to Michigan Tuesday to build public support for his agenda, pitching it as a necessary investment for the U.S. to remain competitive, as Congress wrestles with two legislative packages stacked with his priorities.

title: Sen. Elizabeth Warren Says Fed Suffers From 'Culture of Corruption'
summary: The senator says Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell has 'failed as a leader'. Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D., Mass.) ramped up her rhetorical attacks on Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on Tuesday, lamenting what she called a "culture of corruption" at the central bank.

title: Muni Bond-Backed Fiberboard Plant Seeks Bankruptcy Restructuring
summary: California company says the road to converting rice-farming waste into a wood substitute 'has not been smooth'. A Northern California plant for converting rice-farming waste into a wood substitute filed for bankruptcy protection after work stoppages and cost overruns triggered a roughly $344 million municipal-bond default.

title: 'Ghosts' Review: Drop Dead Funny
summary: This CBS comedy about the diverse spirits haunting an upstate manor is scary good. There are certainly no shows on TV more spirited than "Ghosts" right now and there may be none funnier. Making its debut with two episodes Thursday night, the show concerns a young couple, Jay and Sam (Utkarsh Ambudkar and Rose McIver), who inherit a rambling, ramshackle, 300-year-old mansion in upstate New York. No strings. No tax burden. Free. "There's gotta be something wrong with it," says Jay-at which point we already know enough to chuckle.

title: Dipping a Toe Back Into Live Performance
summary: New York City Ballet recently returned to the stage for in-person shows for the first time since the start of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: GW Bridge Bus Station Lender Sues Port Authority Over Bankruptcy Sale
summary: The lender alleged the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey meddled in a proposed leasehold sale, wiping out foreign investors. A real-estate investment firm that financed the overhaul of a major bus station in northern Manhattan sued the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, accusing the public agency of upending the planned bankruptcy sale of a retail leasehold and wiping out a $72 million loan from foreign investors.

title: Compound Fractures (Wednesday Crossword, October 6)
FDA Authorizes Another At-Home Rapid Test for Covid-19
summary: The authorization could boost availability of the diagnostic tests, which had been in short supply in recent weeks. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration authorized an at-home, rapid Covid-19 test from ACON Laboratories Inc., a move that could potentially double the nation's at-home testing capacity in the next several weeks, the agency said on Monday.

title: Powerball Drawing Finally Has a Winner of Nearly $700 Million Jackpot
summary: Monday's Powerball followed 40 drawings without a Grand Prize winner. A ticket sold in California was the winner of the nearly $700 million Powerball jackpot, ending the longest number of drawings in a row without a Grand Prize winner, Powerball said.

title: A Great Burgundy Vintage on a Budget: Wines to Buy Now
summary: The 2019 vintage in Burgundy was extraordinary, but the premier cru bottles are beyond the budget of most wine drinkers. Our wine columnist found 5 basic white Burgundies that offer a taste of a very good year at an affordable price point.. EXTREME WEATHER happens so frequently these days that when a vintage is described as "dramatic," it almost seems commonplace. Happily, in the case of the 2019 Burgundy vintage, the word "dramatic" is coupled to the word "great."

title: Cotton Prices Surge to Highest Level in a Decade
summary: China buys up U.S. supplies of crop, even as Trump-era import ban limits use of Chinese-grown fiber. Cotton futures are trading at their highest price in about a decade, with growing Chinese demand being met in part by rising U.S. exports to China, a curiosity of Trump-era trade-war policies.

title: NSA Chief Says Ransomware Threat to Remain for Years
summary: U.S. plans a 30-nation summit to discuss how international cooperation can mitigate the impact of cybercrime. Ransomware is likely to remain a threat to U.S. economic and national security for years to come, the country's top military cyber official said Tuesday.

title: Hotel Brands Bet on All-Inclusive Resorts to Counter Covid-19 Slump
summary: Wyndham and Marriott make moves as business travel lags behind leisure recovery. Big hotel companies are adding more all-inclusive resorts, betting that the pandemic will boost a business model that encourages guests to stay in one place.

title: Turo Wants All Your Rides
summary: The Airbnb for car sharing has filed to go public at a time when it is difficult and expensive to get around. Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's car. Thou shalt take it for a spin.

title: 'One of Us Is Lying' Review: The Young and the Remorseless
summary: A murder at a high school has four archetypal suspects in the soapy show based on Karen M. McManus's young-adult thriller.. 'The hellscape that is high school," as someone describes it in "One of Us Is Lying," is hardly unexplored territory. Several current shows-"Never Have I Ever" and "Sex Education," among them-are making comedy gold out of exactly that. Other shows have taken darker paths through the winding corridors of lockers and lust. But the question about "One of Us Is Lying"-part Agatha Christie, part Aaron Spelling-is what, exactly, it's supposed to be: comedy, drama or something else entirely.

title: Where Is Biden's Vaccine Mandate?
summary: It may prove more useful as a Sword of Damocles than a real requirement.. Regarding David Rivkin Jr. and Robert Alt's "Biden's Lawless Vaccine Mandate" (op-ed, Sept. 29): A more accurate headline would be "Biden's Nonexistent Vaccine Mandate." Surprisingly, Messrs. Rivkin and Alt often use the present tense when discussing the mandate. This could lead people to believe that a nonexistent mandate carries the full force of federal authority.

title: Medicare, Dental Benefits and the ADA
summary: The major barrier to obtaining dental care is cost.. Opposition by the American Dental Association (ADA) to proposed legislation to provide dental benefits through Medicare Part B runs counter to the popularity of the legislation among many dentists and the general public ("Dentists' Group Fights Medicare Coverage," U.S. News, Sept. 28).

title: Schools Leave Boys Behind With New Curricula
summary: We turn off their enthusiasm for learning.. There is another reason every bit as compelling as the four outlined by Richard Vedder and Braden Colegrove for "Why Men Are Disappearing on Campus" (op-ed, Sept. 20). A lifelong love of education starts in the elementary grades and yet, as I have witnessed with my grandchildren, the hours per week dedicated to teaching subjects that young boys thrive on, like science and history, have been reduced substantially. Those hours have been reassigned to reading and writing, subjects that girls excel in.

title: Old-Fashioned Originalism and the Case Against Roe v. Wade
summary: Supreme Court justices shouldn't indulge their own moral preferences in interpreting the Constitution.. In "'Originalist' Judges Lose Sight of Truths that Precede Law" (op-ed, Sept. 30), Hadley Arkes proposes a "better originalism" that he thinks is rooted in the "moral ground of the Constitution." But as we old-fashioned originalists recognize, the Constitution's moral ground includes the propositions that judging is distinct from legislating and that Supreme Court justices shouldn't indulge their own moral preferences in interpreting the Constitution.

title: How the Government Saves Money
summary: It isn't the conventional way.. Dan Fishbein, president of Sun Life U.S., defends the paid-leave proposal floating around Washington (Letters, Oct. 2). He states that the federal-government option would cover all the costs for the employer. If the employer chooses the private-plan option, however, the government would reimburse the employer up to 90% of the costs, which "saves the government and the taxpayer that last 10% of the costs."

title: Francis S. Collins to Resign as Director of the National Institutes of Health
summary: The longtime chief has been a leading voice in the fight against Covid-19. Francis S. Collins, the longtime director of the National Institutes of Health who has been a leading voice in the White House battle against Covid-19, announced on Tuesday that he will step down at the end of the year.

title: Delta's Loss Is Service Economy's Gain-Up to a Point
summary: The U.S. service sector was surprisingly strong last month as the Delta variant appeared to peak, but the virus might leave its unique mark on the recovery. So much for the services slowdown, perhaps.

title: Urban Meyer's NFL Tenure Faces Even More Trouble After Viral Videos
summary: Meyer, in his first year in the NFL, was publicly scolded by Jacksonville Jaguars owner Shad Khan in the latest of a series of missteps that has defined his brief tenure. Urban Meyer was publicly scolded by Jacksonville Jaguars owner, Shad Khan, Tuesday in an acceleration of how the college coaching stalwart's move to the pros has rapidly gone off the rails after just a handful of games into his first NFL season.

title: Justice Department Will Review Decision Not to Charge FBI Agents Who Mishandled Nassar Investigation
summary: The move follows searing testimony from Olympic gymnasts and outrage that agents who had disregarded their allegations had not been prosecuted. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department is reviewing its decision not to prosecute the FBI agents who disregarded Olympic gymnasts' allegations that former national team doctor Larry Nassar sexually assaulted them and later made false statements to cover their mistakes.

title: Democrats Must Raise the Debt Themselves
summary: The GOP won't play ball, and a $2 trillion coin gimmick isn't a responsible solution.. On Monday Mitch McConnell sent President Biden a letter insisting, as he has for months, that Democrats bear sole responsibility for raising the nation's debt limit. The president responded by calling Mr. McConnell's position "reckless" and "irresponsible."

title: The Woke Left's Primitive Economics
summary: Zero-sum thinking was adaptive in a world of tribal conflict, but isn't in a modern society.. Karl Marx called his system "scientific socialism." Modern leftists advocate a similar ideology and call themselves "woke" to indicate that they understand the world better than the rest of us. Yet the worldview of Marxists and woke leftists alike is fundamentally primitive.

title: Marketing Veteran Lou Paskalis Named President at Ad Association MMA
summary: Mr. Paskalis, most recently a senior marketing and media executive at Bank of America, was tapped to help the trade association continue to broaden its focus. Lou Paskalis, the former Bank of America Corp. executive known for his fervent stands on challenges facing the advertising business, has joined marketing trade group MMA Global as its president and chief operating officer.

title: Petrobras Concludes Bribery Settlement With U.S. Justice Department
summary: Brazilian state-controlled oil company says it completed its obligations under a nonprosecution agreement. Brazilian state-controlled oil company Petróleo Brasileiro SA said Monday it had completed overhauls to its compliance program, bringing to a close a settlement agreement with U.S. authorities over a vast bribery and kickback scheme in Brazil.

title: Apple Pay Fees Vex Credit-Card Issuers
summary: Banks are nudging Visa to change the way it processes some Apple Pay transactions, according to people familiar with the matter. Banks rushed to work with the Apple Pay mobile wallet when it debuted in 2014. They have some regrets.

title: Nobel Physics Prize Awarded to Trio for Study of Complex Systems
summary: Syukuro Manabe, Klaus Hasselmann and Giorgio Parisi win this year's award for physics. An international trio of scientists shared the Nobel Prize in Physics Tuesday for pioneering ways to find the order hidden in complexity, laying the foundation for computer models that explore how human activity is changing global climate.

title: Researcher or Spy? Maxim Shugaley Saga Points to How Russia Now Builds Influence Abroad
summary: Resume Subscription. Among the first Russians to arrive in Kabul after the Taliban takeover in August was Maxim Shugaley, a shadowy figure working for Kremlin ally Yevgeniy Prigozhin, whom the U.S. holds responsible for interfering in the 2016 election.

title: PepsiCo Juggles Strong Demand, Supply-Chain Challenges
summary: Doritos 3D Crunch, Mtn Dew Flamin' Hot helped drive higher revenue for the latest quarter, but profit fell. PepsiCo Inc. said it raised its guidance for the full year amid strong sales growth of its Mountain Dew, Doritos and other snacks, while the company faces continuing supply-chain disruptions and increased costs for aluminum cans, plastic bottles, labor and trucking.

title: U.S. Trade Deficit Widens to Record as Imports Rebound
summary: Imports rise 1.4%, reflecting higher shipments into the U.S. of consumer goods and industrial supplies. The U.S. trade deficit widened to a record in August as American consumers continued to show a strong appetite for imported goods such as pharmaceutical products, toys and clothing.

title: Better Than 'Law & Order'? A Seat in a Real-Life Courtroom
summary: Resume Subscription. BOSTON-The moment the tense crime drama concluded for the afternoon, the live audience began to argue the fine points of the plot.

title: Writer Liu Cixin on How His Visions of the Future Collide With Reality
summary: The bestselling novelist's 'hard science fiction' books and short stories have explored the fate of humanity-and how the universe might end. Author

title: Before Nirvana and Foo Fighters, Dave Grohl Taught Himself to Play Drums on His Bed Pillows
summary: Resume Subscription. Dave Grohl, 52, is the founder, lead singer and guitarist for Foo Fighters, the former Nirvana drummer and the winner of 16 Grammys. He has written a memoir, "The Storyteller: Tales of Life and Music" (Dey Street). He spoke with Marc Myers.

title: Blinken Meets With French Officials
summary: Relations between the two countries have soured following last month's announcement of security pact among U.S., U.K. and Australia. PARIS-U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken continued his efforts to repair the relationship with the nation's oldest ally, holding a series of meetings with French leaders that yielded promises to deepen cooperation, but no specific commitments.

title: Climate Change Is Melting Russia's Permafrost-and Challenging Its Oil Economy
summary: Resume Subscription. YAKUTSK, Russia-Thawing earth once thought to be permanently frozen is springing to life and threatening a crucial chunk of Russia's economy.

title: Johnson & Johnson Asks FDA to Authorize Covid-19 Booster
summary: The extra dose increased protection to 94% against moderate to severe Covid-19 in a late-stage trial in the U.S., the company said. Johnson & Johnson has asked U.S. health regulators to authorize a booster dose for its Covid-19 vaccine, citing studies showing it improved protection among adults who previously received a single shot.

title: Why It's So Hard to Find a Therapist Who Takes Insurance
summary: Many therapists don't take insurance. The ones who do are often booked. Here's why-and what you can do about it.. Finding a therapist who takes insurance was tough before the pandemic. Now, therapists and patients say, an increase in the need for mental-health care is making the search even harder.

title: Scenes From the Austin City Limits Music Festival
summary: Resume Subscription. AUSTIN, Texas-A city that calls itself the live-music capital of the world has spent a long portion of the pandemic unusually quiet. So what happened when 75,000 fans gathered for three days in a row for a sold-out music festival featuring Billie Eilish, George Strait, St. Vincent, Megan Thee Stallion and Duran Duran, among 100-plus other acts, over the first weekend of October?

title: Bitcoin Price Passes $50,000: What to Watch as the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: Facebook is ticking higher after its services were restored; Amplify Energy is edging up after Monday's rout. Bitcoin is on the rise and stocks opened higher, a day after a selloff among major technology firms dragged down broader indexes. Here's what we're watching as Tuesday's trading session gets under way.

title: Facebook's Temporary Absence Shows Its Far-Reaching Presence
summary: Users world-wide were hit by inability to connect to its services, halting work and sowing panic for many used to instant communication. Facebook Inc.'s hourslong global outage hit users from those waking up in Australia to attendees at a political conference in the U.K., reinforcing how intertwined the company's services are with people's lives across the world.

title: Holmes's Office Romance Now on Display in Court
summary: The relationship between Theranos's founder and her top deputy left a trail of text messages that are playing an important role in her criminal fraud trial. The text message popped up on Elizabeth Holmes's phone in July 2015 from her top deputy at Theranos Inc., Ramesh "Sunny" Balwani.

title: The U.S.-China Trade Conflict Remains Frozen
summary: By keeping existing tariffs, with possible loopholes, Biden walks a fine line between his domestic economic agenda, China hawks and anxious allies. Hawks and doves both had high hopes for U.S. Trade Representative Katherine Tai's long-awaited speech Monday on the Biden administration's China trade agenda. Both were disappointed. The most likely outcome over the next year remains a continuation of the status quo: a frozen conflict.

title: AstraZeneca Submits Preventive Covid-19 Treatment to FDA
summary: AstraZeneca's antibody drug could be an alternative to vaccines for people whose immune systems make existing shots less effective. LONDON- AstraZeneca PLC said Tuesday it has asked U.S. regulators for emergency-use authorization for an antibody drug that earlier this year showed strong efficacy in preventing symptomatic Covid-19, offering a potential alternative in evading the disease.

title: Julianna Margulies on Dating Reese Witherspoon on 'The Morning Show'
summary: The celebrated TV actor discusses joining Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston on the new season of the Apple TV+ drama-and making peace with how 'The Good Wife' affected her family life.. Every time Julianna Margulies accepts a new role, she googles her character's last name. Any information she can find about the etymology of the surname helps her build out an imagined family tree. For her scene-stealing turn in season two of Apple TV+'s The Morning Show this month, in which she plays no-nonsense, prime-time TV interviewer Laura Peterson, her search results helped her better understand the character. "When I looked it up and it said 'sturdy like a rock', I thought, Of course-that's her name," the actor says. "She's this rock amidst all this sandstorm."

title: French Catholic Church Personnel Sexually Abused 330,000 Minors, Probe Finds
summary: Some 3,000 priests and members of religious orders sexually abused children in France since 1950, according to a new report. An investigation of the Catholic Church in France found that priests, church employees and volunteers sexually abused approximately 330,000 minors since 1950.

title: 5 Interior Design Ideas to Max Out Your Basement Space
summary: Design pros see homeowners waste square footage in cellars all the time. Here are the five errors they encounter over and over-from dropped ceilings to bad paneling-and their reliable fixes.. EVEN THE MOST casual horror-movie viewers know that basements are where protagonists go to, as TikTok teens would say, "get unalived." For interior designers, however, the most unnerving part of these spaces isn't who (or what) might be hiding in wait, it's often what's lying in plain sight: their décor.

title: Short-Stay Housing Companies Confident Even as Workers Return to the Office
summary: The firms, raising millions for their short-term apartment rentals, are expanding units and locations. Even as some employers command workers back to the office, a handful of housing providers, flush with new venture funding, are betting that one pandemic trend is here to stay-the demand for flexible, short-term apartment rentals.

title: How Not to Do an Energy Transition
summary: Power markets vary, but Britain's latest troubles hold some lessons for countries focused on decarbonization. For a case study in how not to regulate a power market as it moves to incorporate lower-carbon energy, look at the U.K.

title: Chinese Developer Fantasia Fails to Repay $206 Million Dollar Bond
summary: Notice of the missed payment took some market participants by surprise. SINGAPORE- Fantasia Holdings Group Co. , a developer of luxury apartments in China, said it didn't make a $206 million U.S. dollar bond payment that was due Oct. 4, adding to the malaise surrounding the country's highly indebted property companies.

title: U.S. Companies Pick Up Libor Alternative
summary: Sports-vehicle maker Polaris is among the businesses beginning to use a replacement benchmark. Major U.S. companies are dumping the London interbank offered rate ahead of a year-end deadline for abandoning the troubled short-term interest-rate benchmark.

title: This Startup Says the Stock Market Should Be Open 24/7
summary: Resume Subscription. A startup trading platform is seeking approval from the Securities and Exchange Commission to launch the first U.S. stock exchange that would operate around the clock, including on weekends and holidays.

title: Singapore Set to Increase Control Over Online Content
summary: Government says bill blocks foreign influence campaigns, but opponents say measures could be used to stifle dissent. SINGAPORE-The country's legislature approved a bill that targets foreign influence campaigns by giving Singapore's government new powers over internet content, despite criticism that officials could use them to stifle dissent.

title: Business-Travel Slump Undercuts Hotels as Vacation Season Ends
summary: Hotels see some recent momentum in corporate travel and look to foreign tourists' return. U.S. hotel owners are bracing for another quarter of sluggish business travel, hoping that this year's surge in leisure travel can carry over into the fall and holiday season.

title: SEC's Gensler Aims to Save Investors Money by Squeezing Wall Street
summary: Resume Subscription. WASHINGTON-Wall Street's new overseer has outlined an aggressive regulatory agenda that threatens to squeeze the financial industry's profit margins.

title: Nikki Haley Embraces Trump in Her Vision of GOP Future
summary: Trump's U.N. ambassador says the Republican Party needs the former president, but she believes he was defeated in election. Nikki Haley calls Donald Trump a friend and says she would consult with him before embarking on a White House bid, but the former United Nations ambassador disagrees with the former president when it comes to the outcome of the 2020 election.

title: Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp Services Restored After Hourslong Global Outage
summary: Users had received error messages when trying to access the sites. Facebook Inc.'s services went offline for as much as six hours Monday in an extended outage that disrupted access for users and businesses around the world and left the tech company flailing for a solution.

title: China Flies a Dozen Bombers Near Taiwan, Prompting Protest From Taipei
summary: Beijing's streak of sorties in recent days began as U.S., U.K. and others conducted large-scale exercises east of Taiwan. TAIPEI-China's military flew 56 sorties near Taiwan, including flights by a dozen bombers, from the predawn hours into the night Monday, intensifying a streak in recent days following the arrival of an armada east of the island comprising ships from the U.S., U.K. and four other countries.

title: Tesla Ordered to Pay More Than $130 Million in Damages to Black Former Worker
summary: The company subjected the employee to a racially hostile work environment, jury finds. SAN FRANCISCO- Tesla Inc. subjected a Black former worker to a racially hostile work environment and failed to take reasonable steps to prevent him from being racially harassed, a federal jury found Monday.

title: China Leaps Ahead in Effort to Rein In Algorithms
summary: Beijing is building a system intended to ensure that internet platforms' automated processes are fair, transparent and in line with Communist Party ideology. TAIPEI-A sweeping new plan to restrain the algorithms that power tech platforms has thrust China to the forefront of a growing movement to curb the influence of giant internet companies.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: 'Squid Game' Is the Dystopian Netflix Hit No One Wanted-Until Everyone Did
summary: The South Korean survival drama that for a decade was dismissed as grotesque and unrealistic is on track to become Netflix's most-watched show. SEOUL-South Korea's dystopian drama "Squid Game" might become Netflix Inc.'s biggest hit ever. But for a decade, local studios rejected the fictionalized show's pitch as too grotesque and too unrealistic.

title: New Rule Ends Ban on Federal Funds for Clinics That Refer Abortions
summary: The decision reverses an abortion policy under the Trump administration. The Biden administration Monday reversed a Trump-era policy that stripped federal family-planning dollars from clinics that refer patients for abortions.
